headline: DXC Transforms Meridian Energy's Finance System, Supporting 400,000 Business and Residential Customers
summary: DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC), a Fortune 500 global technology services provider, today announced the successful implementation of a unified Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP and EPM system for Meridian Energy, New Zealand's largest renewable energy generator and retailer. Through this collaboration, DXC has led the modernisation of Meridian Energy's legacy systems, delivering operational efficiency, faster financial reporting and structured procurement compliance – with zero disruption.

raw.headline: DXC Transforms Meridian Energy's Finance System, Supporting 400,000 Business and Residential Customers
raw.summary: DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC), a Fortune 500 global technology services provider, today announced the successful implementation of a unified Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP and EPM system for Meridian Energy, New Zealand's largest renewable energy generator and retailer. Through this collaboration, DXC has led the modernisation of Meridian Energy's legacy systems, delivering operational efficiency, faster financial reporting and structured procurement compliance – with zero disruption.

headline: AI will be major 'force multiplier' for software: Goldman Sachs
summary: From Goldman Sachs' 2025 Communacopia and Technology Conference, Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi speaks with Goldman Sachs US software equity research analyst Kash Rangan about the cooperative relationship between the AI and software industries, the stock narrative around major innovators like Salesforce (CRM), and CoreWeave, and his perspective on other artificial intelligence companies like CoreWeave (CRWV). Oracle (ORCL) is set to release fiscal first quarter earnings figures after the market close on Tuesday, September 9. Also catch Brian Sozzi's full interview with Snowflake (SNOW) CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Oracle (ORCL) is set to release fiscal first quarter earnings figures after the market close on Tuesday, September 9. headline: Exact Sciences And 2 Other Stocks Estimated To Be Trading Below Their Fair Value
summary: As U.S. markets recently touched record highs before experiencing a slight pullback, investors are closely watching economic indicators like the jobs report and Treasury yields, which suggest potential interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. In this environment of fluctuating indices and economic signals, identifying stocks that may be trading below their fair value can offer intriguing opportunities for investors seeking to capitalize on market inefficiencies.
